content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL RULE: Only check PRs authored by Bill (BillChirico) or by Pip Build / sub-agents. Do NOT check, fix, or address PRs from anyone else (other contributors, bots like coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill has explicitly told you to.

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Filter to ONLY Bill's PRs and Pip Build's PRs. Skip everything else.
3) For eligible PRs, check BOTH:
   a) Unresolved inline review threads (paginate ‚Äî max 100/page, use pageInfo cursor).
   b) Top-level/high-level review comments ‚Äî fetch all reviews via `gh api repos/BillChirico/bills-bot/pulls/{number}/reviews` and look for CHANGES_REQUESTED or COMMENT reviews whose body contains actionable feedback NOT already addressed by subsequent commits. Compare the review's commit_id against HEAD to see if new commits exist after the review.
4) If no unresolved threads AND no unaddressed high-level review comments on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads or unaddressed high-level comments exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Include any unaddressed high-level review comment bodies and their review IDs.
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers, unresolved thread counts, and high-level comment counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Tuesday, February 17th, 2026 ‚Äî 2:49 PM (America/New_York)

üß© Analysis chain üåê Web query: `jsonwebtoken npm algorithm confusion vulnerability HS256` üí° Result: ‚ÄúJWT algorithm confusion (RS256 ‚Üí HS256)‚Äù is a **misconfiguration/validation flaw pattern**, not typically a single ‚ÄúHS256 bug‚Äù in `jsonwebtoken` itself: if a server **expects RS256** but **doesn‚Äôt enforce the allowed algorithms**, an attacker who can obtain the **public key** can change the JWT header to `alg: HS256` and then **HMAC-sign with the public key as the ‚Äúsecret‚Äù**, potentially getting the token accepted. OWASP explicitly calls out this risk pattern and notes how Node‚Äôs `jsonwebtoken` API shape can make this mistake easy if you don‚Äôt pin algorithms. [1] Separately, `jsonwebtoken` (npm) **did have** a real verification bypass: **versions ‚â§ 8.5.1** could accept **unsigned** tokens in a specific scenario (no `algorithms` specified + a **falsy** key/secret), due to defaulting to `none`; this was **patched in 9.0.0** (removing default support for `none`). [2] Also, people often mix up `jsonwebtoken` with the similarly named package `json-web-token` (npm), which has a published advisory for an **algorithm-confusion vulnerability** (CVE-2023-48238 / GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355). [3] **What to do (for `jsonwebtoken`):** - **Upgrade to `jsonwebtoken` ‚â• 9.0.0**. [2] - In `jwt.verify`, **explicitly whitelist algorithms** (e.g. only `['RS256']`) rather than relying on defaults. [1] - Don‚Äôt allow both **HS\*** and **RS\***/**ES\*** for the same verifier, and don‚Äôt reuse/publicly expose key material in a way that could be misused as an HMAC secret (the classic RS256‚ÜíHS256 confusion condition). [1] **Sources:** [1] OWASP WSTG ‚Äì Testing JSON Web Tokens (algorithm confusion / RS256‚ÜíHS256) ([owasp.org](https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/06-Session_Management_Testing/10-Testing_JSON_Web_Tokens?utm_source=openai)) [2] GitHub Security Advisory: `auth0/node-jsonwebtoken` GHSA-qwph-4952-7xr6 (‚â§8.5.1, patched 9.0.0) ([github.com](https://github.com/auth0/node-jsonwebtoken/security/advisories/GHSA-qwph-4952-7xr6?utm_source=openai)) [3] GitHub Security Advisory: `joaquimserafim/json-web-token` GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355 (algorithm confusion) ([github.com](https://github.com/joaquimserafim/json-web-token/security/advisories/GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355?utm_source=openai)) Citations: - 1: https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/06-Session_Management_Testing/10-Testing_JSON_Web_Tokens?utm_source=openai - 2: https://github.com/auth0/node-jsonwebtoken/security/advisories/GHSA-qwph-4952-7xr6?utm_source=openai - 3: https://github.com/joaquimserafim/json-web-token/security/advisories/GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355?utm_source=openai --- üèÅ Script executed: ```shell # Check if the file exists and matches the snippet if [ -f "src/api/middleware/oauth.js" ]; then echo "=== File exists, checking lines 29-35 ===" sed -n '25,40p' src/api/middleware/oauth.js else echo "File not found" fi ``` Repository: BillChirico/bills-bot Length of output: 418 ---
**Explicitly specify JWT algorithms to prevent algorithm confusion attacks.** `jwt.verify(token, sessionSecret)` without an `algorithms` option leaves the verification vulnerable to algorithm confusion attacks. This is a real attack pattern where an attacker can change the JWT header algorithm (e.g., from RS256 to HS256) and forge signatures if the verification doesn't enforce which algorithms are acceptable. JWTs are only base64-encoded (not encrypted), so anyone who obtains the token ‚Äî via XSS, logging, browser history, or interception ‚Äî can trivially decode it and extract the Discord access token. This grants the attacker direct Discord API access as the user (profile data, guild list), amplifying the impact of any token leak far beyond the bot's own API surface. The access token would be better stored server-side (e.g., in a database keyed by user ID) with only an opaque reference in the JWT.

","path":"src/api/routes/auth.js","line":243,"createdAt":"2026-02-17T16:53:37Z"}]}},{"id":"PRRT_kwDORICdSM5vGhC5","isResolved":true,"comments":{"nodes":[{"author":{"login":"cursor"},"body":"### Duplicate JWT verification with inconsistent error status **Medium Severity** JWT verification logic is duplicated between `requireAuth` in `auth.js` and `requireOAuth` in `oauth.js`, and they handle the missing `SESSION_SECRET` case differently: `requireAuth` returns 401, while `requireOAuth` correctly returns 500. üß© Analysis chain üåê Web query: `jsonwebtoken npm algorithm confusion vulnerability HS256` üí° Result: ‚ÄúJWT algorithm confusion (RS256 ‚Üí HS256)‚Äù is a **misconfiguration/validation flaw pattern**, not typically a single ‚ÄúHS256 bug‚Äù in `jsonwebtoken` itself: if a server **expects RS256** but **doesn‚Äôt enforce the allowed algorithms**, an attacker who can obtain the **public key** can change the JWT header to `alg: HS256` and then **HMAC-sign with the public key as the ‚Äúsecret‚Äù**, potentially getting the token accepted. OWASP explicitly calls out this risk pattern and notes how Node‚Äôs `jsonwebtoken` API shape can make this mistake easy if you don‚Äôt pin algorithms. [1] Separately, `jsonwebtoken` (npm) **did have** a real verification bypass: **versions ‚â§ 8.5.1** could accept **unsigned** tokens in a specific scenario (no `algorithms` specified + a **falsy** key/secret), due to defaulting to `none`; this was **patched in 9.0.0** (removing default support for `none`). [2] Also, people often mix up `jsonwebtoken` with the similarly named package `json-web-token` (npm), which has a published advisory for an **algorithm-confusion vulnerability** (CVE-2023-48238 / GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355). [3] **What to do (for `jsonwebtoken`):** - **Upgrade to `jsonwebtoken` ‚â• 9.0.0**. [2] - In `jwt.verify`, **explicitly whitelist algorithms** (e.g. only `['RS256']`) rather than relying on defaults. [1] - Don‚Äôt allow both **HS\*** and **RS\***/**ES\*** for the same verifier, and don‚Äôt reuse/publicly expose key material in a way that could be misused as an HMAC secret (the classic RS256‚ÜíHS256 confusion condition). [1] **Sources:** [1] OWASP WSTG ‚Äì Testing JSON Web Tokens (algorithm confusion / RS256‚ÜíHS256) ([owasp.org](https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/06-Session_Management_Testing/10-Testing_JSON_Web_Tokens?utm_source=openai)) [2] GitHub Security Advisory: `auth0/node-jsonwebtoken` GHSA-qwph-4952-7xr6 (‚â§8.5.1, patched 9.0.0) ([github.com](https://github.com/auth0/node-jsonwebtoken/security/advisories/GHSA-qwph-4952-7xr6?utm_source=openai)) [3] GitHub Security Advisory: `joaquimserafim/json-web-token` GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355 (algorithm confusion) ([github.com](https://github.com/joaquimserafim/json-web-token/security/advisories/GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355?utm_source=openai)) Citations: - 1: https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/06-Session_Management_Testing/10-Testing_JSON_Web_Tokens?utm_source=openai - 2: https://github.com/auth0/node-jsonwebtoken/security/advisories/GHSA-qwph-4952-7xr6?utm_source=openai - 3: https://github.com/joaquimserafim/json-web-token/security/advisories/GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355?utm_source=openai --- üèÅ Script executed: ```shell # Check if the file exists and matches the snippet if [ -f "src/api/middleware/oauth.js" ]; then echo "=== File exists, checking lines 29-35 ===" sed -n '25,40p' src/api/middleware/oauth.js else echo "File not found" fi ``` Repository: BillChirico/bills-bot Length of output: 418 ---
**Explicitly specify JWT algorithms to prevent algorithm confusion attacks.** `jwt.verify(token, sessionSecret)` without an `algorithms` option leaves the verification vulnerable to algorithm confusion attacks. This is a real attack pattern where an attacker can change the JWT header algorithm (e.g., from RS256 to HS256) and forge signatures if the verification doesn't enforce which algorithms are acceptable. OWASP explicitly recommends always specifying allowed algorithms.
üîí Proposed fix ```diff - const decoded = jwt.verify(token, sessionSecret); + const decoded = jwt.verify(token, sessionSecret, { algorithms: ['HS256'] }); ```

This token grants full `identify guilds` scope access to the user's Discord account for as long as it remains valid. Options to fix: 1. **Server-side session store**: Store the `accessToken` in a server-side session (e.g., in-memory Map keyed by `userId`, or Redis) and only put the `userId` in the JWT. JWTs are only base64-encoded (not encrypted), so anyone who obtains the token ‚Äî via XSS, logging, browser history, or interception ‚Äî can trivially decode it and extract the Discord access token. This grants the attacker direct Discord API access as the user (profile data, guild list), amplifying the impact of any token leak far beyond the bot's own API surface. The access token would be better stored server-side (e.g., in a database keyed by user ID) with only an opaque reference in the JWT.

","path":"src/api/routes/auth.js","line":243,"createdAt":"2026-02-17T16:53:37Z"}]}},{"id":"PRRT_kwDORICdSM5vGhC5","isResolved":true,"comments":{"nodes":[{"author":{"login":"cursor"},"body":"### Duplicate JWT verification with inconsistent error status **Medium Severity** JWT verification logic is duplicated between `requireAuth` in `auth.js` and `requireOAuth` in `oauth.js`, and they handle the missing `SESSION_SECRET` case differently: `requireAuth` returns 401, while `requireOAuth` correctly returns 500. `102-115`: **Migration relies on the default PostgreSQL constraint name `config_pkey`.** The `DROP CONSTRAINT config_pkey` at line 111 assumes the primary key constraint follows PostgreSQL's default `{table}_pkey` naming convention. This is correct for standard `CREATE TABLE` DDL, but could fail if the constraint was created with a custom name or if the table was renamed. Since this is an internal bot database unlikely to have custom DDL, the risk is low‚Äîjust noting for awareness.

Review Summary ### üî¥ Critical (2) 1. **Global config changes leave guild merged cache stale** (`src/modules/config.js:434`) ‚Äî `mergedConfigCache.delete(guildId)` only removes the current guild's entry. When `guildId` is `'global'`, all other guild merged results remain stale. After `setConfigValue('ai.model', 'new-model')`, `getConfig('guild-123')` still returns the old value from the merged cache. The same issue exists in `resetConfig` for the global path. Fix: call `mergedConfigCache.clear()` when `guildId === 'global'`. 2. **LRU eviction deletes authoritative guild overrides** (`src/modules/config.js:241-244`) ‚Äî `cacheMergedResult()` evicts from `configCache` (the raw override store loaded from DB) when `mergedConfigCache` exceeds `MAX_GUILD_CACHE_SIZE`. After eviction, `getConfig(guildId)` silently returns only global defaults ‚Äî the guild's DB-persisted overrides are lost until restart. Fix: only evict from `mergedConfigCache`, not `configCache`. ### üü° Warning (2) 3. **`hasPermission` uses stale module-level `config`** (`src/index.js:188`) ‚Äî The central permission gate passes the module-level `config` (global cache reference set once at startup on line 57) to `hasPermission()` instead of `getConfig(interaction.guildId)`. Per-guild overrides for `permissions.adminRoleId`, `permissions.allowedCommands`, etc. are silently ignored. Every command handler calls `getConfig(interaction.guildId)`, but this pre-command gate bypasses that. [Fix this ‚Üí](https://claude.ai/code?q=In%20src%2Findex.js%20at%20line%20188%2C%20replace%20%60config%60%20with%20%60getConfig(interaction.guildId)%60%20in%20the%20hasPermission%20call.%20Ensure%20getConfig%20is%20imported%20from%20src%2Fmodules%2Fconfig.js.%20Branch%3A%20feat%2Fper-guild-config&repo=BillChirico/bills-bot) 4. **AGENTS.md not updated** ‚Äî Lines 79-80 still document `getConfig()` and `setConfigValue(key, value)`. The signatures are now `getConfig(guildId?)` and `setConfigValue(path, value, guildId?)`. The "Config Hot-Reload Behavior" section (line 175) also references the old `getConfig()` signature. Per AGENTS.md's own rules: *"Keep docs up to date ‚Äî this is non-negotiable."* [Fix this ‚Üí](https://claude.ai/code?q=Update%20AGENTS.md%20lines%2079-80%20to%20document%20getConfig(guildId%3F)%20and%20setConfigValue(path%2C%20value%2C%20guildId%3F).%20Also%20update%20line%20175%20to%20mention%20getConfig(guildId).%20Branch%3A%20feat%2Fper-guild-config&repo=BillChirico/bills-bot) ### üîµ Nitpick (2) 5. **Reset message misleading for guild-scoped resets** (`src/commands/config.js:341-342`) ‚Äî The embed says "reset to defaults from config.json" for all resets, but for guild resets, the operation deletes guild overrides so global defaults apply ‚Äî which may differ from `config.json` if global config has been modified. Review Summary ### üî¥ Critical (2) 1. **Global config changes leave guild merged cache stale** (`src/modules/config.js:434`) ‚Äî `mergedConfigCache.delete(guildId)` only removes the current guild's entry. When `guildId` is `'global'`, all other guild merged results remain stale. After `setConfigValue('ai.model', 'new-model')`, `getConfig('guild-123')` still returns the old value from the merged cache. The same issue exists in `resetConfig` for the global path. Fix: call `mergedConfigCache.clear()` when `guildId === 'global'`. 2. **LRU eviction deletes authoritative guild overrides** (`src/modules/config.js:241-244`) ‚Äî `cacheMergedResult()` evicts from `configCache` (the raw override store loaded from DB) when `mergedConfigCache` exceeds `MAX_GUILD_CACHE_SIZE`. After eviction, `getConfig(guildId)` silently returns only global defaults ‚Äî the guild's DB-persisted overrides are lost until restart. Fix: only evict from `mergedConfigCache`, not `configCache`. ### üü° Warning (2) 3. **`hasPermission` uses stale module-level `config`** (`src/index.js:188`) ‚Äî The central permission gate passes the module-level `config` (global cache reference set once at startup on line 57) to `hasPermission()` instead of `getConfig(interaction.guildId)`. Per-guild overrides for `permissions.adminRoleId`, `permissions.allowedCommands`, etc. are silently ignored. Every command handler calls `getConfig(interaction.guildId)`, but this pre-command gate bypasses that. [Fix this ‚Üí](https://claude.ai/code?q=In%20src%2Findex.js%20at%20line%20188%2C%20replace%20%60config%60%20with%20%60getConfig(interaction.guildId)%60%20in%20the%20hasPermission%20call.%20Ensure%20getConfig%20is%20imported%20from%20src%2Fmodules%2Fconfig.js.%20Branch%3A%20feat%2Fper-guild-config&repo=BillChirico/bills-bot) 4. **AGENTS.md not updated** ‚Äî Lines 79-80 still document `getConfig()` and `setConfigValue(key, value)`. The signatures are now `getConfig(guildId?)` and `setConfigValue(path, value, guildId?)`. The "Config Hot-Reload Behavior" section (line 175) also references the old `getConfig()` signature. Per AGENTS.md's own rules: *"Keep docs up to date ‚Äî this is non-negotiable."* [Fix this ‚Üí](https://claude.ai/code?q=Update%20AGENTS.md%20lines%2079-80%20to%20document%20getConfig(guildId%3F)%20and%20setConfigValue(path%2C%20value%2C%20guildId%3F).%20Also%20update%20line%20175%20to%20mention%20getConfig(guildId).%20Branch%3A%20feat%2Fper-guild-config&repo=BillChirico/bills-bot) ### üîµ Nitpick (2) 5. **Reset message misleading for guild-scoped resets** (`src/commands/config.js:341-342`) ‚Äî The embed says "reset to defaults from config.json" for all resets, but for guild resets, the operation deletes guild overrides so global defaults apply ‚Äî which may differ from `config.json` if global config has been modified. Consider wording like "reset to global defaults" for guild resets. 6. **GET config test doesn't verify `getConfig` receives the guild ID** (`tests/api/routes/guilds.test.js:144`) ‚Äî The assertion is `expect(getConfig).toHaveBeenCalled()` but should be `expect(getConfig).toHaveBeenCalledWith('guild1')` to verify the route actually passes the guild ID Review Summary The fix commit (38feff0) addressed many of the earlier review findings well ‚Äî CSRF state parameter, algorithm pinning, fragment-based token redirect, fresh guild fetching, `isGuildAdmin` consolidation, and `getPermissionError` level parameter are all solid improvements. **Remaining issues:** **üî¥ Critical (1)** - **Discord access token stored in plaintext JWT** (`src/api/routes/auth.js:126-136`): The Discord OAuth2 access token is embedded directly in the JWT payload. JWTs are signed but not encrypted ‚Äî anyone who obtains the token can base64-decode it and extract the raw Discord access token. Store the access token server-side instead. **üü° Warning (3)** - **Missing `requireGuildAdmin` on stats/members/moderation routes** (`src/api/routes/guilds.js`): Config and actions endpoints correctly have the middleware, but `/:id/stats`, `/:id/members`, and `/:id/moderation` do not. Any OAuth user can access sensitive data for any guild. - **`oauthStates` map grows unboundedly** (`src/api/routes/auth.js:16-28`): Cleanup only runs on new OAuth redirects. Add interval-based cleanup or bound the map size. - **`fetchUserGuilds` called on every admin-gated request** (`src/api/routes/guilds.js:79-89`): Each request to a protected endpoint triggers a Discord API round-trip. Add a short-lived cache to avoid rate limiting. **üîµ Nitpick (1)** - **Missing env vars in `.env.example`**: `SESSION_SECRET` and `DISCORD_REDIRECT_URI` are used but not documented per AGENTS.md `1-39`: **Overall implementation looks solid.** Algorithm restriction to HS256, proper error logging import, clean Bearer extraction, and appropriate HTTP status codes. Previous review concerns have been addressed.
src/api/middleware/auth.js (1)
`36-78`: **Dual-auth flow is clean and well-structured.** The API-secret-first, JWT-fallback approach with `req.authMethod` tagging is a sensible design. Constant-time comparison, HS256 algorithm pinning, and structured log metadata are all in place.
src/api/routes/auth.js (2)
`50-72`: **LGTM ‚Äî OAuth initiation flow is well-structured.** CSRF state generation, env var validation, expired state cleanup on entry, and proper URL construction are all handled correctly. --- `78-168`: **Callback flow handles errors properly.** CSRF state validation with delete-on-use, abort timeouts on all fetches, server-side access token storage, and fragment-based token delivery are all solid. Error logging includes structured metadata.
src/api/server.js (1)
`10-10`: **LGTM ‚Äî Clean integration of auth cleanup and CORS update.** `stopAuthCleanup()` is correctly invoked early in `stopServer()` to prevent further interval ticks, and the `Authorization` header addition in CORS is required for Bearer token authentication. Also applies to: 41-41, 126-127
src/api/routes/guilds.js (1)
`110-121`: **Guild admin middleware and route guards look correct.** The `requireGuildAdmin` middleware properly gates on `authMethod`, and its application to config read/write and actions endpoints aligns with the PR objectives. API-secret passthrough is appropriate for internal/bot calls. Also applies to: 224-224, 246-246, 407-407
src/commands/modlog.js (1)
`34-41`: **LGTM ‚Äî Permission guard is well-implemented.** Runtime `isModerator` check with `getPermissionError('modlog', 'moderator')` provides defense-in-depth alongside the `adminOnly` export, and the ephemeral reply prevents leaking error details to other users.
tests/commands/modlog.test.js (1)
`32-35`: **LGTM ‚Äî Permission denial test properly exercises the guard.** The `isModerator.mockReturnValueOnce(false)` correctly tests the early-return path, and the assertion checks both the error content and ephemeral flag. Also applies to: 76-88
tests/utils/permissions.test.js (1)
`1-321`: **LGTM ‚Äî Thorough test coverage for the permission utilities.** Tests cover all key paths: bot owner bypass (via multiple ID sources), Discord permission flags, config-based admin roles, null/missing config, and the parameterized error message. The null-config edge cases from previous review feedback are now included.
tests/commands/config.test.js (2)
`9-9`: **Permission mocking setup looks good.** The permissions module mock with `isGuildAdmin` defaulting to `true` (allowing most tests to pass the guard) and `getPermissionError` returning a realistic denial message is a clean approach. The `permissions` field in the config mock aligns with the new config shape. Also applies to: 15-18, 22-22 --- `38-58`: **Permission denial test is well-structured.** This test correctly overrides `isGuildAdmin` to return `false` for a single invocation and verifies the ephemeral error reply. Aligns with the source code guard in `src/commands/config.js` (lines 161‚Äì166).
src/utils/permissions.js (3)
`9-23`: **Fallback bot owners with config-driven approach is a good improvement.** The `DEFAULT_BOT_OWNERS` fallback and `isBotOwner` accepting `config` cleanly address the prior review feedback about the hardcoded constant. The null-safe `config?.permissions?.botOwners || DEFAULT_BOT_OWNERS` correctly handles missing config while still allowing the override. --- `93-130`: **`isGuildAdmin` and `isModerator` are well-structured.** `isGuildAdmin` correctly delegates to `isAdmin` (addressing the prior DRY feedback), and `isModerator` provides a sensible lower-privilege tier (ManageGuild + adminRoleId). The guard/bypass ordering mirrors `isAdmin`, which is consistent. --- `132-141`: **`getPermissionError` update is clean.** The `level` parameter with a sensible default provides flexible, user-facing error messages without breaking existing callers.
tests/api/routes/guilds.test.js (3)
`93-99`: **Good test isolation with cleanup of shared state.** Clearing `sessionStore`, `guildCache`, mocks, env stubs, and restoring spies ensures no leakage between tests. --- `136-146`: **JWT Bearer authentication test is well-constructed.** The SESSION_SECRET env stub matches the signing secret used in `createOAuthToken`, and the test correctly validates that the Bearer token is accepted as an alternative to the `x-api-secret` header. --- `158-195`: **GET `/` tests cover the key authorization matrix well.** The three tests verify: (1) API-secret gets unfiltered results, (2) OAuth gets only admin+bot-present guilds, and (3) OAuth with no admin perms gets empty results. The use of `permissions: '8'` (ADMINISTRATOR bitmask) vs `'0'` is correct for Discord's permission model.
tests/api/routes/auth.test.js (3)
`1-34`: **Test setup is clean and minimal.** Logger mock, lightweight client stub, and proper cleanup in `afterEach` are all correct. Passing `null` for `dbPool` is appropriate since auth routes don't need database access. --- `36-69`: **OAuth redirect tests cover the happy path and both misconfiguration cases.** Good coverage of the redirect URL components (client_id, scope, state) and the two failure modes (missing `DISCORD_CLIENT_ID`, missing `DISCORD_REDIRECT_URI`). --- `71-85`: **Callback input validation tests are appropriate.** Testing the `code` and `state` parameter guards without mocking the full Discord token exchange keeps these tests focused and avoids coupling to external API behavior.

package.json (1)
`23-23`: **Addition of `jsonwebtoken` is justified for OAuth2 JWT authentication.** The package is actively used for creating and verifying JWT tokens in the OAuth2 flow: `jwt.sign()` creates tokens in the Discord callback route (with 7-day expiration), and `jwt.verify()` validates Bearer tokens in auth middleware. In `@src/utils/permissions.js`: - Around line 95-112: The two functions isGuildAdmin and isAdmin duplicate logic; consolidate by making one the single source of truth‚Äîe.g., relax the strict config null-check in isAdmin so it safely handles optional config and then have isGuildAdmin simply call and return isAdmin(member, config). Ensure isAdmin still performs isBotOwner(member), checks member.permissions.has(PermissionFlagsBits.Administrator), and if config?.permissions?.adminRoleId is present uses member.roles.cache.has(config.permissions.adminRoleId); remove the duplicated logic from isGuildAdmin so all checks live in isAdmin. - Around line 9-10: BOT_OWNER_ID is hardcoded; switch to reading the owners list from config.permissions.botOwners and remove the constant. Update the module to export a helper that accepts the config (or export a function isBotOwner(config, userId)) and use config.permissions.botOwners (supporting multiple IDs) inside isBotOwner instead of BOT_OWNER_ID; then update all callers of isBotOwner to pass the app config through. Ensure the exported symbol BOT_OWNER_ID is removed/deprecated and references are replaced with the new config-driven isBotOwner usage. In `@tests/commands/config.test.js`: - Around line 15-18: Add a new test that simulates permission denial by mocking isGuildAdmin to return false and asserting the command returns the ephemeral permission error from getPermissionError; specifically, in tests/commands/config.test.js override vi.mock for isGuildAdmin to vi.fn().mockReturnValue(false), call the code path that executes the /config command (the same test helper used elsewhere in this file), and assert the reply is ephemeral and equals getPermissionError() so the permission guard for the config command is exercised end-to-end. In `@tests/commands/modlog.test.js`: - Around line 32-35: Add a test covering the permission-denial path by mocking isModerator to return false, invoking the modlog command's execute function with a created interaction, and asserting the interaction.reply was called with an ephemeral error containing the permission message; specifically, in the test file use isModerator.mockReturnValueOnce(false), call createInteraction('view') (or same helper used elsewhere) then await execute(interaction) and expect(interaction.reply).toHaveBeenCalledWith(expect.objectContaining({ content: expect.stringContaining("don't have permission"), ephemeral: true })); reference isModerator, execute and createInteraction to locate where to add this case. In `@tests/utils/permissions.test.js`: - Around line 244-284: Add a test that passes a null config into isModerator to cover the nullable-config code path: create a member (e.g., with permissions.has mocked to false and roles.cache.has mocked to false) and assert isModerator(member, null) returns false (and add a separate case if needed where member is bot owner or has ManageGuild permission to assert true when config is null). Reference the isModerator function and the existing test patterns (permissions.has and roles.cache.has mocks) to add the new null-config assertions so the implementation's null-config handling is exercised. - Around line 207-242: Add a test that verifies isGuildAdmin handles a null config without throwing: create a non-admin member stub (permissions.has -> false, roles.cache.has -> false) and call isGuildAdmin(member, null) asserting it returns false; place this new case inside the existing describe('isGuildAdmin') block so it covers the optional chaining path in isGuildAdmin. --- Outside diff comments: In `@src/api/routes/guilds.js`: - Around line 243-276: Add the requireGuildAdmin middleware to the guild admin-only routes: include requireGuildAdmin in the route handler chain for router.get('/:id/stats'), router.get('/:id/members') and router.get('/:id/moderation') so the middleware runs before the async handler; if requireGuildAdmin is not already imported in this file, import it and apply it as the second parameter (e.g., router.get('/:id/stats', requireGuildAdmin, async (req, res) => { ... })), ensuring the same change is made for the members and moderation route handlers to restrict access to guild admins only. --- Duplicate comments: In `@src/api/routes/auth.js`: - Around line 146-147: The jwt.verify call in the authentication flow (jwt.verify(token, sessionSecret)) must include an explicit algorithms option to prevent algorithm confusion; update the verify call used in the auth route to pass a third parameter like { algorithms: ['HS256'] } (or the exact algorithm your tokens use) so jwt.verify(token, sessionSecret, { algorithms: [...] }) explicitly restricts allowed signing algorithms and uses the same algorithm setting as in oauth.js. ```

Review Summary The fix commit (38feff0) addressed many of the earlier review findings well ‚Äî CSRF state parameter, algorithm pinning, fragment-based token redirect, fresh guild fetching, `isGuildAdmin` consolidation, and `getPermissionError` level parameter are all solid improvements. **Remaining issues:** **üî¥ Critical (1)** - **Discord access token stored in plaintext JWT** (`src/api/routes/auth.js:126-136`): The Discord OAuth2 access token is embedded directly in the JWT payload. JWTs are signed but not encrypted ‚Äî anyone who obtains the token can base64-decode it and extract the raw Discord access token. Store the access token server-side instead. **üü° Warning (3)** - **Missing `requireGuildAdmin` on stats/members/moderation routes** (`src/api/routes/guilds.js`): Config and actions endpoints correctly have the middleware, but `/:id/stats`, `/:id/members`, and `/:id/moderation` do not. Any OAuth user can access sensitive data for any guild. - **`oauthStates` map grows unboundedly** (`src/api/routes/auth.js:16-28`): Cleanup only runs on new OAuth redirects. Add interval-based cleanup or bound the map size. - **`fetchUserGuilds` called on every admin-gated request** (`src/api/routes/guilds.js:79-89`): Each request to a protected endpoint triggers a Discord API round-trip. Add a short-lived cache to avoid rate limiting. **üîµ Nitpick (1)** - **Missing env vars in `.env.example`**: `SESSION_SECRET` and `DISCORD_REDIRECT_URI` are used but not documented per AGENTS.md src/api/middleware/oauth.js (1)
`1-39`: **Overall implementation looks solid.** Algorithm restriction to HS256, proper error logging import, clean Bearer extraction, and appropriate HTTP status codes. Previous review concerns have been addressed.
src/api/middleware/auth.js (1)
`36-78`: **Dual-auth flow is clean and well-structured.** The API-secret-first, JWT-fallback approach with `req.authMethod` tagging is a sensible design. Constant-time comparison, HS256 algorithm pinning, and structured log metadata are all in place.
src/api/routes/auth.js (2)
`50-72`: **LGTM ‚Äî OAuth initiation flow is well-structured.** CSRF state generation, env var validation, expired state cleanup on entry, and proper URL construction are all handled correctly. --- `78-168`: **Callback flow handles errors properly.** CSRF state validation with delete-on-use, abort timeouts on all fetches, server-side access token storage, and fragment-based token delivery are all solid. Error logging includes structured metadata.
src/api/server.js (1)
`10-10`: **LGTM ‚Äî Clean integration of auth cleanup and CORS update.** `stopAuthCleanup()` is correctly invoked early in `stopServer()` to prevent further interval ticks, and the `Authorization` header addition in CORS is required for Bearer token authentication. Also applies to: 41-41, 126-127
src/api/routes/guilds.js (1)
`110-121`: **Guild admin middleware and route guards look correct.** The `requireGuildAdmin` middleware properly gates on `authMethod`, and its application to config read/write and actions endpoints aligns with the PR objectives. API-secret passthrough is appropriate for internal/bot calls. Also applies to: 224-224, 246-246, 407-407
src/commands/modlog.js (1)
`34-41`: **LGTM ‚Äî Permission guard is well-implemented.** Runtime `isModerator` check with `getPermissionError('modlog', 'moderator')` provides defense-in-depth alongside the `adminOnly` export, and the ephemeral reply prevents leaking error details to other users.
tests/commands/modlog.test.js (1)
`32-35`: **LGTM ‚Äî Permission denial test properly exercises the guard.** The `isModerator.mockReturnValueOnce(false)` correctly tests the early-return path, and the assertion checks both the error content and ephemeral flag. Also applies to: 76-88
tests/utils/permissions.test.js (1)
`1-321`: **LGTM ‚Äî Thorough test coverage for the permission utilities.** Tests cover all key paths: bot owner bypass (via multiple ID sources), Discord permission flags, config-based admin roles, null/missing config, and the parameterized error message. The null-config edge cases from previous review feedback are now included.
tests/commands/config.test.js (2)
`9-9`: **Permission mocking setup looks good.** The permissions module mock with `isGuildAdmin` defaulting to `true` (allowing most tests to pass the guard) and `getPermissionError` returning a realistic denial message is a clean approach. The `permissions` field in the config mock aligns with the new config shape. Also applies to: 15-18, 22-22 --- `38-58`: **Permission denial test is well-structured.** This test correctly overrides `isGuildAdmin` to return `false` for a single invocation and verifies the ephemeral error reply. Aligns with the source code guard in `src/commands/config.js` (lines 161‚Äì166).
src/utils/permissions.js (3)
`9-23`: **Fallback bot owners with config-driven approach is a good improvement.** The `DEFAULT_BOT_OWNERS` fallback and `isBotOwner` accepting `config` cleanly address the prior review feedback about the hardcoded constant. The null-safe `config?.permissions?.botOwners || DEFAULT_BOT_OWNERS` correctly handles missing config while still allowing the override. --- `93-130`: **`isGuildAdmin` and `isModerator` are well-structured.** `isGuildAdmin` correctly delegates to `isAdmin` (addressing the prior DRY feedback), and `isModerator` provides a sensible lower-privilege tier (ManageGuild + adminRoleId). The guard/bypass ordering mirrors `isAdmin`, which is consistent. --- `132-141`: **`getPermissionError` update is clean.** The `level` parameter with a sensible default provides flexible, user-facing error messages without breaking existing callers.
tests/api/routes/guilds.test.js (3)
`93-99`: **Good test isolation with cleanup of shared state.** Clearing `sessionStore`, `guildCache`, mocks, env stubs, and restoring spies ensures no leakage between tests. --- `136-146`: **JWT Bearer authentication test is well-constructed.** The SESSION_SECRET env stub matches the signing secret used in `createOAuthToken`, and the test correctly validates that the Bearer token is accepted as an alternative to the `x-api-secret` header. --- `158-195`: **GET `/` tests cover the key authorization matrix well.** The three tests verify: (1) API-secret gets unfiltered results, (2) OAuth gets only admin+bot-present guilds, and (3) OAuth with no admin perms gets empty results. The use of `permissions: '8'` (ADMINISTRATOR bitmask) vs `'0'` is correct for Discord's permission model.
tests/api/routes/auth.test.js (3)
`1-34`: **Test setup is clean and minimal.** Logger mock, lightweight client stub, and proper cleanup in `afterEach` are all correct. Passing `null` for `dbPool` is appropriate since auth routes don't need database access. --- `36-69`: **OAuth redirect tests cover the happy path and both misconfiguration cases.** Good coverage of the redirect URL components (client_id, scope, state) and the two failure modes (missing `DISCORD_CLIENT_ID`, missing `DISCORD_REDIRECT_URI`). --- `71-85`: **Callback input validation tests are appropriate.** Testing the `code` and `state` parameter guards without mocking the full Discord token exchange keeps these tests focused and avoids coupling to external API behavior.

## PR Review Fix: bills-bot PR #74 (feat/per-guild-config)

**Repo:** /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/
**Branch:** `feat/per-guild-config`
**PR:** #74 ‚Äî "feat: per-guild configuration (multi-tenancy)"

Read and follow CODING.md before starting.

### Unresolved Review Threads to Fix

**1. `src/modules/ai.js` line 412** (claude ‚Äî Warning)
`generateResponse` receives its `config` parameter from `events.js` which passes the module-scoped global config captured at startup. This means `config.ai?.systemPrompt`, `config.ai?.model`, `config.ai?.maxTokens` all read from the **global** config even though `guildId` is available. A guild that customizes these via `/config` will have overrides silently ignored. Consider using `getConfig(guildId)` inside this function.

**2. `src/modules/config.js` line 31** (claude ‚Äî Nitpick)
The comment explains rationale for unbounded `configCache` well, but should document the expected upper bound (e.g., "bounded by the number of guilds that have customized config, which mirrors the DB row count") or add a size warning log when it exceeds a threshold.

**3. HIGH-LEVEL: AGENTS.md not updated** (claude ‚Äî CHANGES_REQUESTED)
Lines 79-81 still document `getConfig()` and `setConfigValue(key, value)`. The signatures are now `getConfig(guildId?)` and `setConfigValue(path, value, guildId?)`. Line 81 says "Config is a live object reference" which is only true for the global path. The "Config Hot-Reload Behavior" section and `onConfigChange` callback signature (now with `guildId` as 4th arg) also need updating. Per AGENTS.md: "Keep docs up to date ‚Äî this is non-negotiable."

**4. NITPICK: Reset message misleading** (`src/commands/config.js` lines 339-342)
For guild resets, the message says "reset to defaults from config.json" but the operation removes guild overrides so global defaults apply (which may differ from config.json if modified at runtime). Should say "reset to global defaults" for guild resets.

### Instructions
- Fix ALL issues above (including nitpicks ‚Äî they're from Claude/coderabbit reviewers)
- Run tests and ensure they pass
- Resolve the GitHub review threads after fixing
- Do NOT post PR summary comments
- Report completion summary back

## PR Review Fix: bills-bot PR #73 (feat/guild-admin-auth)

**Repo:** /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/
**Branch:** `feat/guild-admin-auth`
**PR:** #73 ‚Äî "feat: guild admin authentication & authorization"

Read and follow CODING.md before starting.

### Unresolved Review Threads to Fix (9 total)

**From claude[bot]:**

1. **`src/api/routes/auth.js` line 38** ‚Äî Warning: `has()` bypasses `get()` TTL check internally. Both `has()` and `get()` implement the same TTL-check-and-delete logic. Consider having `has()` delegate to `this.get()`:
```js
has(userId) {
  return this.get(userId) !== undefined;
}
```

2. **`src/api/routes/guilds.js` line 72** ‚Äî Warning: `isOAuthGuildAdmin` fetches guilds on every guarded request. Documents that `Number(guild.permissions)` silently produces `NaN` if `permissions` is undefined, which correctly denies access by accident. Could benefit from an explicit guard for clarity.

3. **`src/api/utils/discordApi.js` line 45** ‚Äî Warning: Discord API error status leaked in thrown error message. In `auth.js:273`, the `/me` endpoint silently swallows the error with empty `catch {}`. Consider logging the failure: `error('Failed to fetch guilds for /me', { error: err.message, userId })`.

4. **`src/api/routes/auth.js` line 273** ‚Äî Nitpick: Silent `catch {}` hides guild-fetch failures. The `/me` endpoint silently returns `guilds: []` with no log entry. Add logging:
```js
} catch (fetchErr) {
  error('Failed to fetch guilds for /me', { error: fetchErr.message, userId });
}
```

5. **`src/api/routes/guilds.js` line 142** ‚Äî Nitpick: Redundant null guard after filter. The `.filter()` already ensures `botGuilds.has(ug.id)` is true, so `botGuilds.get(ug.id)` will always return a value. The `if (!botGuild) return null` and `.filter(Boolean)` are unreachable dead code. Could simplify.

**From coderabbitai[bot]:**

6. **`src/api/routes/auth.js` line 275** ‚Äî Nitpick: Silent catch swallows all guild-fetch errors without logging. Same as #4 ‚Äî log at error level so operators can diagnose.

7. **`src/api/routes/guilds.js` line 114** ‚Äî Minor: `validateGuild` runs before `requireGuildAdmin` ‚Äî minor guild-presence information leak for OAuth users (404 vs 403). Low practical risk since guild IDs are snowflakes.

8. **`src/api/utils/discordApi.js` line 49** ‚Äî Minor: No validation that the Discord response is actually an array before caching. Add: `if (!Array.isArray(guilds)) throw new Error('Discord API returned non-array guild data');`

9. **`tests/utils/permissions.test.js` line 336** ‚Äî Nitpick: Consider using the mocked `PermissionFlagsBits.ManageGuild` constant instead of re-deriving `1n << 5n`.

### Instructions
- Fix ALL issues above (including nitpicks)
- Run tests and ensure they pass
- Resolve the GitHub review threads after fixing
- Do NOT post PR summary comments
- Report completion summary back

[Tue 2026-02-17 14:56 EST] [System Message] [sessionId: a62f671f-7ffe-4b08-9c78-62a01c2c171d] A subagent task "## PR Review Fix: bills-bot PR #74 (feat/per-guild-config)

**Repo:** /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/
**Branch:** `feat/per-guild-config`
**PR:** #74 ‚Äî "feat: per-guild configuration (multi-tenancy)"

Read and follow CODING.md before starting.

### Unresolved Review Threads to Fix

**1. `src/modules/ai.js` line 412** (claude ‚Äî Warning)
`generateResponse` receives its `config` parameter from `events.js` which passes the module-scoped global config captured at startup. This means `config.ai?.systemPrompt`, `config.ai?.model`, `config.ai?.maxTokens` all read from the **global** config even though `guildId` is available. A guild that customizes these via `/config` will have overrides silently ignored. Consider using `getConfig(guildId)` inside this function.

**2. `src/modules/config.js` line 31** (claude ‚Äî Nitpick)
The comment explains rationale for unbounded `configCache` well, but should document the expected upper bound (e.g., "bounded by the number of guilds that have customized config, which mirrors the DB row count") or add a size warning log when it exceeds a threshold.

**3. HIGH-LEVEL: AGENTS.md not updated** (claude ‚Äî CHANGES_REQUESTED)
Lines 79-81 still document `getConfig()` and `setConfigValue(key, value)`. The signatures are now `getConfig(guildId?)` and `setConfigValue(path, value, guildId?)`. Line 81 says "Config is a live object reference" which is only true for the global path. The "Config Hot-Reload Behavior" section and `onConfigChange` callback signature (now with `guildId` as 4th arg) also need updating. Per AGENTS.md: "Keep docs up to date ‚Äî this is non-negotiable."

**4. NITPICK: Reset message misleading** (`src/commands/config.js` lines 339-342)
For guild resets, the message says "reset to defaults from config.json" but the operation removes guild overrides so global defaults apply (which may differ from config.json if modified at runtime). Should say "reset to global defaults" for guild resets.

### Instructions
- Fix ALL issues above (including nitpicks ‚Äî they're from Claude/coderabbit reviewers)
- Run tests and ensure they pass
- Resolve the GitHub review threads after fixing
- Do NOT post PR summary comments
- Report completion summary back" just completed successfully.

# üî® PR Patrol Complete ‚Äî bills-bot

Scanned **3 open PRs**, acted on **2** (skipped #68 ‚Äî not authored by Bill or Pip Build).

---

## PR #73 ‚Äî `feat/guild-admin-auth` ‚úÖ
> **9 unresolved review threads fixed** across 8 commits

| Issue | Fix |
|---|---|
| `SessionStore.has()` duplicated TTL logic | Delegates to `this.get() !== undefined` |
| `Number(guild.permissions)` silently ‚Üí NaN | Added explicit `Number.isNaN()` guard |
| Discord API error status leaked in throw | Log server-side, throw generic message |
| Silent `catch {}` hides guild-fetch errors | Added `error()` logging with message & userId |
| Redundant null guard + `.filter(Boolean)` | Removed unreachable dead code |
| `validateGuild` before `requireGuildAdmin` leaks guild presence | Reordered middleware per route |
| No array validation on Discord API response | Added `Array.isArray()` check |
| Test re-derives `1n << 5n` | Uses `PermissionFlagsBits.ManageGuild` from mock |

**All 1043 tests passing** ¬∑ **10/10 threads resolved** ¬∑ Pushed to `feat/guild-admin-auth`

---

## PR #74 ‚Äî `feat/per-guild-config` ‚úÖ
> **4 unresolved review threads fixed** in 1 commit

| Issue | Fix |
|---|---|
| `generateResponse` ignoring per-guild config | Now uses `getConfig(guildId)` for systemPrompt/model/maxTokens |
| `configCache` growth undocumented | Added upper-bound comment (bounded by DB row count) |
| AGENTS.md stale signatures | Already fixed in prior commits ‚úÖ |
| Reset message misleading | Already says "global defaults will apply" ‚úÖ |

**All 1022 tests passing** ¬∑ **2/2 threads resolved** ¬∑ Pushed to `feat/per-guild-config`

---

-# Both PRs are ready for re-review. No merge conflicts with main.

3. **Top-level `channels.discord.token` was invalid** (401 Unauthorized) ‚Äî a stale/expired token at the top level. Not the primary cause but could cause confusion. Bill provided the correct Pip main token and it was set on `channels.discord.accounts.pip.token`.

### Config Changes Made

- Added `main` agent to `agents.list` with `default: true`
- Added `workspace` to `build` agent in `agents.list`
- Updated `pip` Discord account token
- All via `gateway config.patch` (never direct file edits)

### Key Learnings

- `config.patch` on array items does **shallow merge by `id`** ‚Äî if you patch only `{id, workspace}`, the existing `model` config gets dropped. Must include ALL fields when patching

# üî® PR Patrol Complete ‚Äî bills-bot

Scanned **3 open PRs**, acted on **2** (skipped #68 ‚Äî not authored by Bill or Pip Build).

## PR #73 ‚Äî `feat/guild-admin-auth` ‚úÖ
> **9 unresolved review threads fixed** across 8 commits

| Issue | Fix |
|---|---|
| `SessionStore.has()` duplicated TTL logic | Delegates to `this.get() !== undefined` |
| `Number(guild.permissions)` silently ‚Üí NaN | Added explicit `Number.isNaN()` guard |
| Discord API error status leaked in throw | Log server-side, throw generic message |
| Silent `catch {}` hides guild-fetch errors | Added `error()` logging with message & userId |
| Redundant null guard + `.filter(Boolean)` | Removed unreachable dead code |
| `validateGuild` before `requireGuildAdmin` leaks guild presence | Reordered middleware per route |
| No array validation on Discord API response | Added `Array.isArray()` check |
| Test re-derives `1n << 5n` | Uses `PermissionFlagsBits.ManageGuild` from mock |

**All 1043 tests passing** ¬∑ **10/10 threads resolved** ¬∑ Pushed to `feat/guild-admin-auth`

---

## PR #74 ‚Äî `feat/per-guild-config` ‚úÖ
> **4 unresolved review threads fixed**

| Issue | Fix |
|---|---|
| `generateResponse` ignoring per-guild config | Now uses `getConfig(guildId)` for systemPrompt/model/maxTokens |
| `configCache` growth undocumented | Added upper-bound comment (bounded by DB row count) |
| AGENTS.md stale signatures | Already fixed in prior commits ‚úÖ |
| Reset message misleading | Already says "global defaults will apply" ‚úÖ |

**All 1022 tests passing** ¬∑ **2/2 threads resolved** ¬∑ Pushed to `feat/per-guild-config`

---
